ETYMOLOGY: From Italian trombone, augmentative of tromba ('trumpet'), literally 'large trumpet'.
SINCE: c. 1750 (referring to the modern instrument, though the instrument type dates to the 15th century as the sackbut)

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A large brass musical instrument with a U-shaped sliding tube (slide) used to vary the length of the column of air and thus the pitch, played by blowing into a cup-shaped mouthpiece.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种大型铜管乐器，带有一个U形的滑动管（拉管），通过改变空气柱的长度来调整音高，演奏时吹奏杯形吹嘴。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The jazz band featured a powerful solo performance on the trombone.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这支爵士乐队的长号独奏表演非常精彩。
